DataElement.preferredName: Liver Toxicity Diagnosis Finding And/Or Evaluation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the liver toxicity diagnosis and/or evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Liver Toxicity Diagnosis Finding And/Or Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium.  It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg.  Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions.  It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.)_Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: .11/8/12mn-Concept definition change in NCIt for 'Finding C3376' Was: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom). Now: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease. no version change needed.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Liver Toxicity Evaluation And/Or Finding Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium.  It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg.  Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions.  It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than Integer::5 Percentage Weight Gain

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than Integer::5 Percentage Weight Gain
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part.::5: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.: An increase in overall body mass.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
An increase in total body weight.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses sound waves to measure characteristics of disturbed bood flow, such as direction, velocity and turbulence. This enables the examiner to differentiate between normal and abnormal flow patterns and, in some cases, to quantitate those characteristics that are helpful in determining the severity of abnormal flow states.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options: A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses sound waves to measure characteristics of disturbed bood flow, such as direction, velocity and turbulence. This enables the examiner to differentiate between normal and abnormal flow patterns and, in some cases, to quantitate those characteristics that are helpful in determining the severity of abnormal flow states.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The use of high-frequency sound waves to generate images of the body.

PermissibleValues.value: Right upper quadrant pain or tenderness
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Right Upper Quadrant Pain Or Tenderness

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Right Upper Quadrant Pain Or Tenderness
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Upper; higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.: One quarter of a circle. In anatomy, one part of an area divided into quarters for descriptive purposes.: An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Discomfort elicited through touch or pressure.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.
One quarter of a circle. In anatomy, one part of an area divided into quarters for descriptive purposes.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Discomfort elicited through touch or pressure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Elevated; raised or increased.: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.: A protein that speeds up chemical reactions in the body.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
Molecules that catalyze a chemical reaction. They are usually proteins, although catalytic RNA and DNA molecules have been identified.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Elevated; raised or increased.: Refers to the liver.: Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.: The force applied to a unit area of surface.: A graded change in the magnitude of some physical quantity or dimension.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.
Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.
Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.
The force applied to a unit area of surface.
A graded change in the magnitude of some physical quantity or dimension.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part.::2.0: A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.: A bile pigment that is a degradation product of HEME.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
A dark orange, yellow pigment that is the product of the breakdown of iron in the blood; it is conjugated in the liver and excreted in the bile.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Autopsy; an examination and dissection of a dead body to determine cause of death or the changes produced by disease.

Concepts.definition: A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hepatomegaly; abnormal enlargement of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Abnormal enlargement of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.  The fluid may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
